snippet: Some cash-starved African states are showing an assertiveness that suggests the days of China’s unbridled influence as a mega-investor may be waning.
abstract: Several cash-starved African nations are pushing back against China as it seeks widespread access to their oil wealth, in some cases accusing China of greed or environmental negligence; show of assertiveness suggests that days of China’s unbridled influence as a mega-investor may be waning.

byline.contributor: Grace Liu contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Some cash-starved African states are showing an assertiveness that suggests the days of China’s unbridled influence as a mega-investor may be waning.

headline.main: China Finds Resistance to Oil Deals in Africa
headline.print_headline: China Finds Resistance To Oil Deals In Africa
